alert.note: Alert for Coastal Brunswick; Columbus; Inland Brunswick (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 10 at 11:49PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Brunswick, south central Columbus and Horry Counties through 1230 AM EST... At 1148 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms along a line extending from near Socastee to near Myrtle Beach to 13 miles south of Little River Entrance. Movement was northwest at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Myrtle Beach, Conway, North Myrtle Beach, Surfside Beach, Sunset Beach, Ocean Isle Beach, Myrtle Beach Airport, Little River, Socastee, Red Hill, Springmaid Pier, Garden City, North Myrtle Beach Airport, Cherry Grove Inlet, Horry, Iredell, Carolina Shores, Loris, Calabash and Hickory Grove. This includes the following highways... US Route 17 in Brunswick County between mile markers 1 and 10. SC Highway 31 between mile markers 5 and 24. SC Highway 22 between mile markers 1 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EST for southeastern North Carolina...and northeastern South Carolina.
